addAlpha

public boolean addAlpha()

colorValue

public long colorValue(Matrix<? extends PArray> packedMatrix,
                       java.awt.Color color,
                       int bankIndex)
Description copied from class: MatrixToBufferedImageConverter
Converts the color into a form, stored in the data buffer, returned by MatrixToBufferedImageConverter.toDataBuffer(Matrix).

The default implementation is suitable for monochrome, indexed and multi-bank data buffers.

Note: if the packed matrix is monochrome or indexed, i.e. getBandCount(packedMatrix)==1, this method returns 

 Math.round(0.3 * color.getRed() + 0.59 * color.getGreen() + 0.11 * color.getBlue())

The good idea is to provide identical R, G, B color components in such cases (if this method is not overridden).

Overrides:
colorValue in class MatrixToBufferedImageConverter
Parameters:
packedMatrix - the packed data.
color - some color.
bankIndex - index of the bank in terms of java.awt.image.DataBuffer.
Returns:
the corresponded component of this color or packed RGB-Alpha value, depending on the structure of the data buffer.

public java.lang.String toString()

toDataBuffer

protected java.awt.image.DataBuffer toDataBuffer(PArray packedArray,
                                                 int bandCount)
Description copied from class: MatrixToBufferedImageConverter
Actual method, on which MatrixToBufferedImageConverter.toDataBuffer(Matrix) is based.

The passed AlgART array must be direct accessible.

Specified by:
toDataBuffer in class MatrixToBufferedImageConverter
Parameters:
packedArray - the packed data.
bandCount - the number of bands: if called from MatrixToBufferedImageConverter.toDataBuffer(Matrix), it is 1 for 2-dimensional matrix and dim(0) for 3-dimensional matrix.
Returns:
the newly allocated DataBuffer with the same data.

rgbAlphaMasks

protected int[] rgbAlphaMasks(int bandCount)
Description copied from class: MatrixToBufferedImageConverter
Returns the band masks, which will be passed to Raster.createPackedRaster method, if you want to convert data into a packed BufferedImage. The resulting array may be null, that means an unpacked form of the raster (Raster.createBandedRaster), or an array containing bandCount elements: red, green, blue and (if necessary) alpha masks.

Overrides:
rgbAlphaMasks in class MatrixToBufferedImageConverter
Parameters:
bandCount - the number of masks (3 or 4, in other cases null is returned).
Returns:
the bit masks for storing bands in the packed int values.
